title: China steps in to regulate brutal '996' work culture
description: Workers in China are fed up with the brutal 12-hour work days once seen as a key driver of success.

title: Why picking a good company name is a tricky business
description: With the number of new start-ups soaring they all have to choose a name for themselves.

title: Singing baboon, giggling seal and other comedy creatures
description: An angry starling and a lounging bear were also among the competition finalists.

title: Beaten and humiliated by Hindu mobs for being a Muslim in India
description: Attacks on Muslims by Hindu mobs have risen in India, with little apparent official condemnation.

title: Inger Stoejberg: Danish ex-immigration minister faces impeachment trial
description: Inger Stoejberg is accused of unlawfully ordering the separation of young asylum-seeking couples.

title: Driver shortage: 'I got a big pay rise overnight'
description: As the UK's shortage of lorry drivers continues, those with the right skills are very much in demand.

title: Dontae Sharpe: 'My 26-year fight to prove my innocence'
description: After two decades wrongfully behind bars, Dontae Sharpe is finally free but there's one more battle to fight.

title: Mental Health: The ambulance workers feeding callers
description: A Merseyside mental health ambulance team is offering food support for its most in need patients.

title: Paralympics: How hand-cycling saved my life
description: In preparation for the Paralympics, South Korean hand-cycling champion, Doyeon Lee has been riding more than 300km every week.

title: Afghanistan women's cricket team: Players hiding in Kabul fear Taliban rule
description: Members of Afghanistan's women's cricket team are hiding in Kabul, fearing for their safety following the Taliban's return to power.

title: Texas abortion law: What women make of six-week abortion ban
description: Anti-abortion activists celebrate but a doctor who could be targeted by new law fears for the future.

title: Afghanistan: Joe Biden speech on withdrawal fact-checked
description: How consistent is President Biden in his comments on Afghanistan following the final US troop withdrawal?

title: Smith retains individual Paralympic boccia title
description: Britain's David Smith likens himself to footballer Cristiano Ronaldo as he retains his Paralympic boccia individual title.

title: Tokyo Paralympics: Gordon Reid and Alfie Hewett reach semi-finals
description: Defending champion Gordon Reid and Rio silver medallist Alfie Hewett both made it into to the men's singles semi-finals.

title: West Sussex foster couple cared for more than 600 children
description: Pauline and Roger Fitter say watching the results of their efforts has been very rewarding.

title: Banksy-painted building in Lowestoft adds £200k to asking price
description: The old electrical shop is now up for sale at £500,000 after Banksy confirmed the art was genuine.

title: Creamfields: Tiesto fan's ashes fired from confetti cannon in headline set
description: A celebration of Stuart Mitchell's life ended with his ashes being released during Tiesto's set.

title: Afghanistan: Taliban parade captured equipment in Kandahar
description: The militant group showcased the kit captured during their takeover of Afghanistan.

title: Children's internet code: What is it and how will it work?
description: The ICO's Children's Code will make technology companies reassess how they offer services to children.

title: Afghanistan: Rescued animals 'in amazing condition' in UK
description: Most of the 150 animals rescued by "Pen" Farthing's charity are to be adopted by veterans.

title: Becky Redfern: The 'tough ride' to becoming a Paralympic silver medallist
description: Becky Redfern said it was "an incredible feeling" to win Paralympic bronze in the SB13 100m breaststroke, just over a year after giving birth to her first child.

title: Afghanistan: How can the West stop terror bases?
description: The foreign secretary says the UK will fight ISIS-K by all means available - but what does that mean?

title: Colin Pitchfork: Double child murderer released from prison
description: Colin Pitchfork was jailed in 1988 for raping and murdering two 15-year-old girls in Leicestershire.

title: Barca let Griezmann rejoin Atletico & replace him with Sevilla's De Jong
description: Summer of upheaval ends at Barcelona as Antoine Griezmann rejoins La Liga champions Atletico Madrid and striker Luuk de Jong join from Sevilla.

title: Benjamin Mendy: Manchester City player to remain in custody on rape charges
description: Defender Benjamin Mendy, who has been charged with rape, has a bail application refused by a judge.

title: ITV cleared over Piers Morgan's Meghan comments
description: TV watchdog Ofcom rejects a record 58,000 complaints about his criticism of the Duchess of Sussex.

title: JoJo Maman Bebe hikes prices for first time in 5 years
description: The baby goods retailer tells the BBC that it has raised prices for the first time in five years.

title: New eco-petrol baffles a quarter of motorists
description: E10 is set to become the new standard petrol, but 24% of drivers are unaware of it, says the RAC.

title: Jamie Spears 'dragging feet' on conservatorship
description: The pop star's father has been accused of trying to extort his daughter before departing the role.

title: DaBaby 'genuinely engaged' with US black HIV groups
description: The rapper joined a virtual meeting with nine leaders from HIV groups to learn about the virus.

title: Afghanistan: UK and Taliban in talks over further evacuations
description: A UK official is in Qatar for talks to secure the exit of both UK and Afghan nationals, No 10 says.

title: Majestic birds caught by the camera
description: A selection of the winners in this year's Bird Photographer of the Year competition.

title: Afghan refugees: Those who worked for UK can stay permanently
description: Evacuees who worked for the British military and UK government will be given indefinite leave to remain.

title: CEO Secrets: 'I was making money, but had no money'
description: Honey boss Scott Davies says cash flow problems meant though he was profitable he "had no money".

title: Texas passes law banning abortion after six weeks
description: The law, one of the most restrictive in the US, passes as the Supreme Court fails to block it.

title: Family of ducks waddles through University of Nottingham library
description: The mother and her ducklings were "calm and unflustered" as they walked around George Green Library.

title: Drugs: The county lines gang in our Powys cul-de-sac
description: What happens when drug dealers move in to a small, rural town?

title: England v India: Virat Kohli faces questions over batting and captaincy
description: Virat Kohli's aggressive leadership inspires India at times, but it looks childish when it doesn't come off, says cricket journalist Suresh Menon.

title: Newspaper headlines: UK in talks with Taliban and new 'miracle jab'
description: The front pages focus on the Western withdrawal from Afghanistan and a new drug to prevent heart attacks.

title: British teenager Raducanu wins on debut in US Open main draw
description: British teenager Emma Raducanu again shows her talent and maturity on the Grand Slam stage as she eases to victory on her US Open main-draw debut.
